description.narrative: Svenska ambassaden i Bolivia har mottagit en begäran från UNFPA - Bolivia för att stödja förlängningen av projektet "Ungdomar och unga människors sexuella och reproduktiva rättigheter och prevention,behandling och sanktioner mot sexuellt våld" under året 2016 ".Syftet med projektet är just att stärka tillämpningen i politik, program och institutionella ramverk, framförallt på lokal och regional nivå. Huvudmålet med projektet är det att stärka ungdomars SRHR och skydd mot sexuellt våld. Som delmål är att stärka civila samhällets kapacitet att formulera, påverka och delta i beslut rörande deras SRHR. Det andra målet är att stärka statliga myndigheters kapacitet att integrera SRHR i sin politik, program och även lagstiftning. Projektet skall framförallt utföras i samarbete med regionala och lokala aktörer, inklusive ungdomsledda grupper och organisationer. UNFPA har valt ut 5 regioner och i dessa 12 kommuner där arbetet kommer koncentreras, men de kommer också arbeta centralt med påverkansarbete och utveckling av statens kapacitet. I projektet kommer statliga och icke-statliga aktörer att samarbeta för SRHR inom flertalet sektorer.

UNFPA SRHR. The project main objective is to contribute to the fulfillment of adolescents and youth’s sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) including the right to live a life without sexual violence (SV). It aims, on one hand, to strengthen civil society organization’s capacities to formulate, advocate and monitor the implementation of public policies for SRHR; and on the other; to foment duty-bearers accountability to formulate political policies and implement mechanisms to guarantee the young peoples’ SRHR. The project includes advocacy on national level, but will mainly be implemented by UNFPA in collaboration with social organizations including youth-led organizations and state institutions in 12 municipalities in 5 regions. The national and departmental working groups on SRHR are key partners in the project.

The main objective is to contribute to the fulfillment of adolescents and young people’s sexual and reproductive rights (SRHR) and the right to live a life without sexual violence (SV). The specific objectives are: 1) to strengthen the social organizations advocacy and capacities to formulate, control and monitor the implementation of public policies in areas related to young people’s SRHR and the prevention, attention and sanction of sexual violence 2) to strengthen duty-bearers accountability on national and local level to formulate and implement public policies to guarantee the fulfilment of young people’s and adolescents’ SRHR and a life without sexual violence.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The project has during this pilot year contributed to established and implemented public policies and state mechanisms to protect SRHR and to increased awareness and use of SRHR services among young people.Some important results are: 1. The commitment to strengthen services and the network for the prevention of violence is high among the participating municipalities and that they have been able to recieve more cases. They are together with a large number of organizations, carrying out activities in different foras in their geographical areas. 2. All participating organizations in all municipalities have integrated in their planning a SRHR agenda. 3. 100% of the municipalities involved with social and legal services attend cases on sexual violence.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
